STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
April 9, 2025
Jolyne J Baarck
FAMILY YOUTH INTERVENTIONS
418 CASS AVE,
MOUNT CLEMENS, MI, 48043-2123
Re: License #: CI500201123
Dear Ms. Baarck:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
02/24/2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the corrective
action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be completed
orimplemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Brittany Cowans, Licensing Consultant
enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records.
(1) An institution shall maintain employee records for
each employee and shall include documentation
of all of the following information prior to
employment or at the time specified in this rule:
2

(e) Three dated references which are
obtained prior to employment from
persons unrelated to the employee and
which are less than 12 months old.
Two out of six applicable employee files did not contain the required three
references prior to date of hire.
Employee records.
CCI Rule 400.4113
(1)An institution shall maintain employee records
for each employee and shall include
documentation of all of the following information
prior to employment or at the time specified in this
rule:
(i) Documentation from the Michigan
department of human services, the
equivalent state or Canadian provincial
agency, or equivalent agency in the
country where the person usually resides,
that the person has not been determined
to be a perpetrator of child abuse or child
neglect. The documentation shall be
completed not more than 30 days prior to
the start of employment and every 12
months thereafter.
Two out of six applicable employee files reviewed did not have current central
registry checks completed every 12 months after the start of employment.
One out of six applicable employee files reviewed did not have a central registry
check completed 30 days prior to date of hire. .
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Technical assistance was provided regarding the discharge status to show
unplanned/planned and to be more detailed regarding these discharges to include
any medical or dental services (provided or not) in a brief summary.
• Technical assistance was provided to the facility regarding a camera policy.
3

V. CONSULTATION
The agency did not require or request consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The facility had one Corrective Action Plan approved during this reporting period.
The rule violation was regarding discharge planning for youth as there was not a
statement that the discharge plan was shared with a parent or the worker. Action
item included a new form to be implemented to replace the old version. This
corrective action plan was successfully implemented in that the rule was not a
repeat violation during this reporting period.
Financial Overview
Yearly budgeting for the facility was provided by the overseeing organization and
the independent financial audit, no concerns were noted.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was reviewed. The Chief Administrator stated
staff continuously complete client care monitoring of all the written documentation
within the client files. The program manager assures the implementation of fire
drills, monitors nightly bed checks, and ensures full compliance with health and fire
inspections. FYI's Director monitors any and all licensing changes and updates and
changes agency policies, if and when required.
Staff and Youth Interviews
One direct staff and one administrator were interviewed. No concerns were noted
and the employees provided positive feedback regarding the company and its
services.
There are currently no youth at the facility.
4

Description of Agency Walk Through
A walk through of the entire facility was completed. The facility was well
maintained, clean, and well organized. All bedrooms had appropriate bedding;
however, they are not in use at this time. The bathrooms were viewed to have
running water, working sinks, and working showers. The kitchen was in clean
condition with a menu posted. There was an appropriate amount of food in the
refrigerator, freezer and pantry. The fire extinguishers were up-to-date. Emergency
plans and numbers were posted. There were no safety concerns noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
__________________________________3/31/2025_
